title: Laurent Lacaze Santos
text:
I am a geographer, engaged in geospatial analysis and location intelligence projects at NielsenIQ. In the field of geographic information science and socio-spatial demographics, my research extends over several domains such as consumer and market analysis, retail, real estate, transport and environment risk and conservation.
Over the past few years, I have studied the spatial organizations of stores and the consumption of fast-moving consumer goods, specially on supermarket and hypermarket channels.
I hold a master’ s degree in geosciences (governance of risk and resources) from University of Heidelberg and geospatial sciences (geographic information science and computing) from University College London.
You can find my detailed CV here.

title: Laurent Lacaze Santos
text:
Reserch Interest

Geography of consumption (supply and demand perspectives)
Retail geography
Socio-spatial inequalities
Urban geography and modelling

title: Laurent Lacaze Santos
text:
Education

MSc in Geospatial Sciences - Geographic Information Science and Computing (2018-2020)
University College London (UCL) - Department of Civil, Environmental and Geomatic Engineering
Supervisor: Dr. James Haworth
Dissertation title: “Impacts of Covid 19 on Urban Air Pollution in London”, awarded September 2020
MSc in Geography- Governance of Risk and Resources (2017-2018)
Universität Heidelberg - Geographisches Institut Heidelberg
Supervisor: Dr. Alexander Siegmund
Dissertation title: “Geospatial Analysis to Sustainable Development: The Case Study of UNESCO Biosphere Reserve La Campana-Peñuelas, Chile”, awarded November 2018
PGDip in Geomatics (2016)
Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile - Instituto de Geografía
BSc in Business Administration (1997)
Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (PUC-Rio)

title: Laurent Lacaze Santos
text:
Publications

Santos, L.  (2025). Censo2022: Revisão da Estrutura Territorial e dos Agregados Censitários. [Quarto e-book]. Available at: https://laurentlsantos.github.io/IBGE-AgregadosCensitarios/
Santos, L., & Castillo, F.  (2019). Introduction to Spatial Network Forecast with R. [Bookdown e-book]. Available at: https://laurentlsantos.github.io/forecasting/
Santos, L., & Jiang, R., (2018). ‘Spatial analysis of house price determinants: A greater London case study’, CEGE0097, Spatial Analysis and Geocomputation. University College London. Unpublished. Available at: https://blog.politics.ox.ac.uk/russias-constitutional-reform-and-putins-plans-for-a-legacy-of-stability/
Santos, L., & Handke, M., (2018). ‘The doctrinal view of slim state: Brazilian National Agency of Petroleum, Natural Gas and Biofuels multilevel governance’, CM01, Environmental Theory and Politics. Universität Heidelberg. Unpublished. Available at: https://blog.politics.ox.ac.uk/russias-constitutional-reform-and-putins-plans-for-a-legacy-of-stability/

title: Laurent Lacaze Santos
text:
Work Experience

NielsenIQ - Market and consumer intelligence research.  Geomarketing Manager (Jan 2022 to present)
Ellandi - Real Estate asset management - Data Scientist and Data Science Consultant (from August 2020 to December 2021). London, UK
Vendi - Retail of telephone and accessories. Spatial Data Scientist (May 2019 to November 2019). London, UK
Independent GIS Consultant - (March 2016 to August 2018). Santiago, Chile
